Package io.github.ajevans.dbcode.data.io

Interface IDataConsumer

All Known Implementing Classes:
DerbyConsumer, FlatFileConsumer, HadoopConsumer
public interface IDataConsumer
Interface for classes that store data.

Note that classes must have a default constructor only, for building into automatic loading systems.

Each store (e.g. a dataset or directory) may have a set of record stores (e.g. tables or files) each containing records (e.g. rows).

Note that exceptions should generally be re-thrown from implementations where not dealt with, allowing users of implementations to deal with the exceptions as part of a broader system. Exception messages should therefore be user friendly.

Author:
Andy Evans
Version: 1.0 01 Mar 2021

  • Method Details

    • initialise

      void initialise​(IDataset dataset) throws DataException
      Sets up the data store.

      If a store path and/or record store names haven't been set using the setSource / setRecordStoreNames methods, this method should deal with this.

      It should then create the relevant store and record stores. It may or may not wish to check whether they already exist.

      Parameters:
      dataset - Dataset to store - note that this need not be filled with records as long as it has metadata / field data.
      Throws:
      DataException - If issues arise.

    • bulkLoad

      void bulkLoad​(IDataset dataset) throws DataException
      Method should load a whole dataset into current store.

      May or may not wipe prior data. Implementers may like to call disconnectStore at the end of processing to disconnect and garbage collect.

      Parameters:
      dataset - Array of data.
      Throws:
      DataException - If there is an issue.

    • load

      void load​(ArrayList<IRecord> records) throws DataException
      Appends set of records to current store.

      This should be used to push small numbers of records to the consumer in low memory conditions. Implementers are encouraged to limit links to these objects outside of the method (e.g. immediately writing them to a database) so the supplier can garbage collect them.

      Parameters:
      records - ArrayList of data records.
      Throws:
      DataException - If there is an issue.

    • setStore

      void setStore​(String store) throws DataException
      Should set store location to use.

      If this isn't set via this method, it should be drawn from defaults or the dataset in initialise.

      Parameters:
      store - Store to connect to.
      Throws:
      DataException - If there is an issue.

    • setRecordStoreNames

      void setRecordStoreNames​(ArrayList<String> recordStoreNames) throws DataException
      Should set the record store names for the store.

      Record stores within a store will be, e.g. tables within a database or files within a directory.

      If these aren't set via this method, they should be drawn from defaults or the dataset in initialise.

      If set here directly (for example, the user enters the name/s), it is the implementers responsibility to make sure the number of record stores named and number supplied in the dataset to initialise match up or initialise should throw an exception.

      Parameters:
      recordStoreNames - Names of record stores to connect to.
      Throws:
      DataException - Only is there is an issue.
      See Also:
      initialise(IDataset dataset)

    • addReportingListener

      void addReportingListener​(IReportingListener reportingListener)
      For objects wishing to get progress reports on data reading.
      Parameters:
      reportingListener - Object wishing to gain reports.
      See Also:
      IReportingListener

    • connectStore

      void connectStore() throws DataException
      Should connect to current store.
      Throws:
      DataException - If there is an issue.

    • disconnectStore

      void disconnectStore() throws DataException
      Should disconnect from current store and, if present, record stores.

      Implementations should use this as an opportunity to force a garbage collection.

      Throws:
      DataException - If there is an issue.

    • load

      @Deprecated void load​(IDataset dataset) throws DataException
      Deprecated.
      This would usually be a synonym for bulkLoad but is demanded as some stores may have need for alternative loading routes dependent on e.g. file size (though see load(ArrayList<IRecord> records)).
      Method should load a whole dataset into current store.

      May or may not wipe prior data.

      Parameters:
      dataset - Array of data.
      Throws:
      DataException - If there is an issue.
      See Also:
      load(ArrayList<IRecord> records)
